pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.3.1: According to SP.2.620 this means repeatedly lifting a mouthful. Since the following rule refers to breaking pieces off a ball of food, this rule may refer to biting repeatedly into the same ball of food.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.11: According to SP.2.615 khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk44:1.12: For phalāphale see PED, s.v. ā⁴.
